intro: Chrysosplenium sangzhiense, commonly known as the Sangzhi spleenwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Spongiaceae. It is native to China, specifically found in the Sichuan province, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are often basal and have a distinctive, somewhat fleshy texture. Chrysosplenium sangzhiense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
